articles.title: Brazil and Argentina eye a common currency similar to the euro, with Latin American nations invited to join
articles.description: The proposal comes as Argentina battles high inflation and as many emerging markets seek alternatives to the strong US dollar.
articles.content:
Argentina and Brazil are in the preliminary stages of renewing discussions on forming a common currency for financial and commercial transactions, reviving an often-discussed plan that would face numerous political and economic hurdles.

articles.title: Brazil: President Lula sacks army commander after anti-government riots
articles.description: The veteran leftist's dismissal of Julio Cesar de Arruda came a day before Lula was to make his first trip abroad -- to Argentina -- as he moves to put the South American powerhouse back on the international stage
articles.content:
Brasília, Brazil: President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva sacked the commander of Brazil’s army Saturday, two weeks after an election-denying mob loyal to his far-right predecessor ransacked the halls of power in Brasilia.

articles.title: Latin American presidents throw weight behind campaign to free Julian Assange
articles.description: The leaders of Mexico, Brazil and Argentina have urged US president Joe Biden to drop the charges against the WikiLeaks founder and set him free.
articles.content:
The campaign to free WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange is being stepped up following support from the presidents of all major Latin American countries.
